meanings.definition: To incorrectly measure or estimate the size, amount, or extent of something.
meanings.sent1: She kept misgauging the ingredients while baking the cake.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter realized he was misgauging the length of the board.
meanings.sent3: After misgauging the distance, they ended up taking the wrong turn.
meanings.sent4: His misgauging of her feelings led to an awkward situation.
meanings.sent5: Misgauging the weight of the package caused him to struggle while lifting it.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake in assessing or evaluating something.
meanings.sent1: They were misgauging the situation and ended up making the wrong decision.
meanings.sent2: The student realized he was misgauging the difficulty of the exam.
meanings.sent3: By misgauging the value of the antique, they missed out on a great deal.
meanings.sent4: Misgauging the importance of the meeting, he arrived late.
meanings.sent5: She regretted misgauging the impact of her words on her friend.
